intro: Centauropsis decaryi, commonly known as the Decary’s centauropsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
